page.title: 05LAW AND ORDER - HEDINGHAM
page.content: The only Police Station in the area is in Castle Hedingham and is dated 1914. It is manned by a sergeant and 3 other policemen. No women P.C.'s are present. There is one vehicle, a Vauxhall Chevette. There is one cell but this is used for storage only. A courtroom is attached and is used regularly. There are three shifts to cover the 24hr. day The opening hours are 9-10am and 6-7pm. The blue light on the police van is the first target for vandals. A considerable amount of lost property is handed in. 40% of this is not claimed. Contact between police and children is encouraged by the existence of a Liaison Officer. He visits the school regularly to talk to the children about road safety and the dangers of speaking to strangers.
